Name: Fried Rice

Ingredients.Name: cup mixed vegetables (like peas and corn)
Fresh cilantro and lime wedges (for garnish)

Instructions.Name: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large wok or skillet over medium heat.
Add beaten eggs and scramble until just set, then remove from the wok and set aside.
In the same wok, add the remaining oil and cook the garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add the meat or shrimp and cook until done.
Stir in the carrot and mixed vegetables, cooking until tender.
Add the cooked rice to the wok, breaking up any clumps.
Stir in soy sauce, fish sauce, and sugar, mixing everything well.
Add the scrambled eggs back to the wok and mix.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and lime wedges.

About_detail: Khmer Fried Rice is a simple and flavorful dish from Cambodia that features stir-fried rice with a mix of vegetables, eggs, and sometimes meat or seafood. It's seasoned with a combination of soy sauce and fish sauce, giving it a delicious umami flavor with a touch of sweetness.

Name: Red Curry

Ingredients.Name: fish sauce (or soy sauce for a vegetarian version)

Instructions.Name: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Add red curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Pour in coconut milk and stir to combine.
Add chicken or tofu and cook until almost done.
Add bell peppers and carrot; simmer until vegetables are tender and chicken is cooked through.
Stir in fish sauce and brown sugar; adjust seasoning to taste.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil leaves.
Serve with jasmine rice and a squeeze of lime juice.

About_detail: Thai Red Curry is a rich and aromatic dish featuring a flavorful red curry paste cooked with coconut milk, vegetables, and meat or tofu. It’s known for its balanced combination of spicy, sweet, and savory flavors.

Name: Chicken fajitas

Ingredients.Name: Optional toppings: sour cream, salsa, cheese, guacamole

Instructions.Name: Slice the chicken, bell peppers, and onion into thin strips.
In a bowl, mix chicken with olive oil and fajita seasoning.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat, add the chicken, and cook until done.
Add the sliced peppers and onions to the skillet and sauté until tender.
Serve the cooked chicken and veggies in warm tortillas.
Add your favorite toppings, and enjoy!

About_detail: Chicken fajitas are a flavorful and vibrant dish featuring marinated and grilled chicken strips served with sautéed bell peppers and onions, all wrapped in warm tortillas. It’s a quick and delicious meal that combines smoky, tangy, and savory flavors.

Name: Fish and chips

Ingredients.Name: Optional: malt vinegar, tartar sauce, peas

Instructions.Name: Peel and cut potatoes into thick strips; rinse and pat dry.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
For the batter, mix flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper. Gradually add cold sparkling water until smooth.
Coat fish fillets in flour, then dip in batter.
Fry fish until golden and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Fry potato strips in batches until crispy and golden, about 4-5 minutes.
Drain fish and chips on paper towels, season with salt, and serve with optional malt vinegar or tartar sauce.

About_detail: Fish and chips is a classic British dish featuring crispy battered fish served with thick-cut fries. The fish is typically cod or haddock, and the chips are often thick, fluffy, and golden brown.

Name: Spaghetti Bolognese

Instructions.Name: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions; drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, carrot, and celery; cook until softened.
Add ground beef, cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon.
Stir in tomato paste, canned tomatoes, beef broth, oregano, and basil. Simmer for 20-30 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti, and top with grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

About_detail: Spaghetti Bolognese is a classic Italian pasta dish featuring a rich and savory meat sauce made with ground beef, tomatoes, onions, and various herbs. It's typically served over spaghetti noodles and often topped with Parmesan cheese.
